docs.title: Fei Zuo, Ph.D.
docs.text:
Assistant Professor
  • Email: fzuo (at) uco.edu
  • Office: MCS 130
  • Department of Computer Science
  • University of Central Oklahoma
    • [Google Scholar] [ORCID] [Instagram] [LinkedIn]

docs.title: About
docs.text: I am an assistant professor at University of Central Oklahoma. I obtained my Ph.D. degree in the department of computer science and engineering at University of South Carolina. My main research interest is System and Software Security, with a focus on applying new advances in AI to address various cybersecurity challenges, including but not limited to software analysis, system provenance, and mobile computing. I additionally work on adversarial learning and deep learning. I am the graduate program director at the department of computer science. If you are a prospective student interested in our programs, or if you are already enrolled and need advisement about your college journey, please email csgrad@uco.edu.

docs.title: News and Ads
docs.text:
• Will serve as Tutorials Co-Chair of ACM SIGCSE Virtual 2026. We look forward to your active participation.

  • Have been invited to join the editorial board of Future Generation Computer Systems.

  • Have been invited to join the program committees of the following conferences: ★ SECRYPT'26; ★ GLOBECOM'26; ★ SecureComm'26; ★ AIAI'26; ★ EAAAI'26;

docs.title: Past Activities
docs.text:
• Travel award from NSF CISE Research Expansion Aspiring PI Workshop, which was held in Miami, FL (Dec. 18-19, 2025).
  • Successfully organized the 26th ACM SIGCITE annual conference as a steering committee member, in Sacramento, CA (Nov. 6-8, 2025).
  • Successfully organized the 2nd International Workshop on Edge Intelligence and Vehicular Networks in conjunction with MASS'25 in Chicago, U.S. (Oct. 6-8, 2025).
  • Received the RCSA travel grant for conference participations, Sep. 2025.
  • Visited Flagstaff, Arizona, and presented our work at the 33rd CCSC Rocky Mountain Conference (Oct. 18-19, 2024).
  • Successfully organized the International Workshop on Edge Intelligence and Vehicular Networks in conjunction with MASS'24 in Seoul, South Korea (Sep. 23-25, 2024).
  • Joined the editorial board of ACM Transactions on Computing Education, Sep. 2024.
  • Received the RCSA travel grant for conference participations, Aug. 2024.
  • Travel award from the 4th HPC Security Workshop, which was co-organized with the 3rd OAK Supercomputing Conference in Wichita, Kansas (May 20-23, 2024).
  • Joined the editorial board of Digital Threats: Research and Practice, May 2024.
  • Research work was presented during the 2024 Research Day at the Oklahoma Capitol as the representative of UCO, Mar. 2024.
  • Delivered a research talk at University of Southern Maine, Oct. 2023.
